verse:
<sup><small>25</small></sup> Whom have I in heaven but you? And earth has nothing I desire besides you.
<sup><small>26</small></sup> My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.

<sup><small>10</small></sup> But he knows the way that I take; when he has tested me, I will come forth as gold.
<sup><small>11</small></sup> My feet have closely followed his steps; I have kept to his way without turning aside.

<sup><small>8</small></sup> For my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways, declares the Lord. 
<sup><small>9</small></sup> As the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways and my thoughts than your thoughts.
<sup><small>9</small></sup> Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.

<sup><small>14</small></sup> For Christ's love compels us, because we are convinced that one died for all, and therefore all died. 
<sup><small>15</small></sup> And he died for all, that those who live should no longer live for themselves but for him who died for them and was raised again.
<sup><small>16</small></sup> This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ laid down his life for us. And we ought to lay down our lives for our brothers and sisters.

<sup><small>20</small></sup> I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I now live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.
<small><sup>10</sup></small> For if, while we were God's enemies, we were reconciled to him through the death of his Son, how much more, having been reconciled, shall we be saved through his life!

<small><sup>3</sup></small> The Son is the radiance of God's glory and the exact representation of his being, sustaining all things by his powerful word. After he had provided purification for sins, he sat down at the right hand of the Majesty in heaven.

<small><sup>6</sup></small>  You see, at just the right time, when we were still powerless, Christ died for the ungodly. 
<small><sup>7</sup></small> Very rarely will anyone die for a righteous person, though for a good person someone might possibly dare to die. 
<small><sup>8</sup></small> But God demonstrates his own love for us in this: While we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
<small><sup>24</sup></small> "He himself bore our sins" in his body on the cross, so that we might die to sins and live for righteousness; "by his wounds you have been healed."

<small><sup>23</sup></small> Then he said to them all: Whoever wants to be my disciple must deny themselves and take up their cross daily and follow me. 
<small><sup>24</sup></small> For whoever wants to save their life will lose it, but whoever loses their life for me will save it.

<small><sup>23</sup></small> for all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God, 
<small><sup>24</sup></small> and all are justified freely by his grace through the redemption that came by Christ Jesus.
<small><sup>1</sup></small> Now, brothers and sisters, I want to remind you of the gospel I preached to you, which you received and on which you have taken your stand.

<small><sup>6</sup></small> This is also why you pay taxes, for the authorities are God's servants, who give their full time to governing. <small><sup>7</sup></small> Give to everyone what you owe them: If you owe taxes, pay taxes; if revenue, then revenue; if respect, then respect; if honor, then honor.
<small><sup>8</sup></small> Let no debt remain outstanding, except the continuing debt to love one another, for whoever loves others has fulfilled the law.
<small><sup>18</sup></small> For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.

<small><sup>9</sup></small> If you declare with your mouth, “Jesus is Lord,” and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved. 
<small><sup>10</sup></small> For it is with your heart that you believe and are justified, and it is with your mouth that you profess your faith and are saved.

<small><sup>20</sup></small> But Christ has indeed been raised from the dead, the firstfruits of those who have fallen asleep. 
<small><sup>21</sup></small> For since death came through a man, the resurrection of the dead comes also through a man. 
<small><sup>22</sup></small> For as in Adam all die, so in Christ all will be made alive.

<small><sup>55</sup></small> “Where, O death, is your victory?
 Where, O death, is your sting?”
 <small><sup>56</sup></small> The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law. 
<small><sup>57</sup></small> But thanks be to God! He gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

<small><sup>28</sup></small> I give them eternal life, and they shall never perish; no one will snatch them out of my hand. 
<small><sup>29</sup></small> My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all; no one can snatch them out of my Father's hand. 
<small><sup>30</sup></small> I and the Father are one.”

<small><sup>20</sup></small> For since the creation of the world God's invisible qualities—his eternal power and divine nature—have been clearly seen, being understood from what has been made, so that people are without excuse.

<small><sup>11</sup></small> “‘As surely as I live,' says the Lord,
 ‘every knee will bow before me;  
every tongue will acknowledge God.'”

<small><sup>18</sup></small> For you know that it was not with perishable things such as silver or gold that you were redeemed from the empty way of life handed down to you from your ancestors, 
<small><sup>19</sup></small> but with the precious blood of Christ, a lamb without blemish or defect.

<small><sup>27</sup></small> To them God has chosen to make known among the Gentiles the glorious riches of this mystery, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory. 
<small><sup>28</sup></small> He is the one we proclaim, admonishing and teaching everyone with all wisdom, so that we may present everyone fully mature in Christ.
<small><sup>25</sup></small> Therefore he is able to save completely those who come to God through him, because he always lives to intercede for them.
<small><sup>10</sup></small> For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.

<small><sup>5</sup></small> In your relationships with one another, have the same mindset as Christ Jesus: 
<small><sup>6</sup></small> Who, being in very nature God, did not consider equality with God something to be used to his own advantage; 
<small><sup>7</sup></small> rather, he made himself nothing by taking the very nature of a servant, being made in human likeness. 
<small><sup>8</sup></small> And being found in appearance as a man, he humbled himself by becoming obedient to death—even death on a cross!
<small><sup>25</sup></smallI know that my redeemer[a] lives, and that in the end he will stand on the earth.
<small><sup>15</sup></small> Instead, speaking the truth in love, we will grow to become in every respect the mature body of him who is the head, that is, Christ.
